error_description: handleMalformedJson(HttpMessageNotReadableException) returns the result of ex.getMostSpecificCause().getMessage() directly to clients, potentially exposing internal parser or framework error details and implementation hints (information disclosure) instead of a sanitized generic message

getByUsername(String) constructs a native SQL query via string concatenation ("SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = '" + username + "'") and executes it through EntityManager, introducing a classic SQL injection vulnerability and breaking for usernames containing quotes

checkLogin(LoginRequest) calls userRepository.findByUsername(username).get() without checking presence, so missing users cause NoSuchElementException (500 error) instead of a controlled UnauthorizedException; the subsequent null-check on user and DUMMY_HASH fallback are dead code, defeating the intended timing-attack mitigation
